div.p: Auguſta Lachrymans: A Funeral TEAR, TO THE MEMORY OF THE Worthy and Honour'd Michael Godfrey, Eſq LATE DEPUTY-GOVERNOUR of the ROYAL BANK of ENGLAND: Unfortunately Slain by a Cannon Ball, near His Majeſty's Perſon, in the Trenches, at the Siege of NAMƲRE.
London: Printed, and are to be Sold by Rich. Baldwin, near the Oxford-Arms-Inn, in Warwick-Lane, 1695.

div.head: Auguſta Lachrymans.
A FUNERAL TEAR To the MEMORY of the Worthy and Honour'd Michael Godfrey, Eſq &c.

lg.l: VIRTUE, that Plumes the Great, and Decks the Fair,
Religion's Eldeſt Mate, and Heav'n's Co-Heir!
VIRTUE, that Perfum'd Balm, whoſe Fragrant Breath
At once both Softens LIFE, and Sweetens DEATH;
At Thy Ʋntimely, and Lamented Fall,
No Common Tears muſt wait Thy FUNERAL.
So our lov'd GODFREY fell! A more mourn'd Head
Was never Lodg'd in HONOUR's Fatal Bed.
Hard-fated Loyalty! Thou cam'ſt to Pay
A Bended Knee; but Proſtrate Life muſt Lay.
When the too keen Devourer, WAR, in all
His Sulphur Fires, Bright Steel, or Sooty Ball,
Doals round his Deaths 'mongſt his own Slaughter'd Sons,
The Crimſon Stream there but Half pitied, runs:
But at this Thunder's too Ill guided Blaſt,
War Bluſht, and ev'n Bellona ſtood agaſt.
The Diſmal Tale to England's Mourning Shore,
With broken Trumps the Poſting Tritons bore:
The Wayling Nereids the ſad Accents felt;
Nor cou'd their Briny Neptune leſs than melt.
But, of Thy Mourners, Fair AƲGƲSTA's Chief;
So Vaſt her Loſs, and Intereſted Grief:
Nor cou'd her own ſad Plaints, and murm'uring Cries,
For her dear GODFREY's Funeral Rites ſuffice;
Both from her Greſham, and her Floating Walls,
A Brethren-Troop of all Wet Eyes ſhe calls.
One Trickling Tear too, from Britannia run;
The Pious Sorrow for her Darling Son.
Battle, with all his Bolts Commiſſion'd Rage,
That Theatre of Fate, that Bloody Stage,
Acted, alas! but Half Thy Tragick Part:
BELGIA's the Blow, but ALBION's is the Smart.
But, hark! methinks Thy Fame's ſweet Trumpetſounds
That Tuneful Muſick o're Thy Glorious Wounds:
The Angry BOLT, by an Exchanging Stroke,
The GODFREY for the Ranſom'd CAESAR took.
Thy Interpoſing Breaſt to Catch the Blow
Aim'd at Great WILLIAM's Life, and EƲROPE's too.
Whil'ſt Thou the Tutelar Bar to That dire Doom,
Champion of Britain, Fence of Chriſtendom,
Thus Fal'n; Oh! let that Single Fame out-pride
A Mauſoloeum, or a Pyramide.
Since Thou muſt Bleed; ſo Bleed! Nor is it more,
Than Thy Great Predeceſſor did Before:
Whoſe Martyrdom Thy equal Glory Sings;
The GODFREY's Race ev'n born the Shield of Kings!
But, at the Shock of this Lamented Blow,
(So deep the Channels from our Sorrows flow;)
Yet ſtill, if poſſible, ev'n to Rebate
A little the keen Edge of Thy Hard Fate;
From Filial Eyes no ſtreaming Currents glide,
Nor Sabled Widow ſwells the Briny Tide:
Some Mercy, ev'n in Cruelty, there ſhin'd,
And Thy too angry Stars were yet ſo Kind,
At leaſt, thoſe Drowning Streams of Grief to ſave:
No Portia, nor Cornelia, waits Thy Grave.
What, tho' no Childrens Cries! Beneath Thee none!
Enough that All, Around, Thy Loſs bemoan!
Enough Thy Country is a Mourner here!
Enough the Pitying NASSAƲ drops a Tear!
Enough!—Too much, what thy ſad PARENT bears!
The Fountain of thy LIFE, the Fountain of thy TEARS!
Nay, after all Thy Herſes Sable Train,
And our ſoft trickling Drops, th' Effeminate Rain,
Bedews th' Inexorable Grave in vain:
Beyond thoſe Sorrow's Pompous Cavalcade,
Thou haſt thoſe Funeral Rites yet ſtill unpaid,
That deeper Mourning Dye; A warm, warm Flood
Of Nobler Crimſon Currents, Tears of Blood:
Streams, which Great WILLIAM's Conqu'ring Vengeance pours,
And Fair BRITANNIA's Glorious Thunder ſhow'rs:
Whil'ſt Trembling Gallia's VVounded Sides, all goar'd
By her Bold Hunter's keen purſuing Sword;
Her flowing Gore a Tribute to Thy Ʋrn,
Thy very Enemies Thy Loſs ſhall Mourn.
So Mourn'd, and, Oh! ſo Loſt! that Worth, where ſhin'd
The Lovelieſt Graces, that adorn Mankind!
For, Oh! How vaſt a Maſs enricht that MIND!
TRUST, and Fair FAITH were ſo entirely Thine,
Thy BREAST the Quarry to TRUTH's Golden Mine.
Did'ſt Thou but PROMISE, 'twas Thy Stamp & Seal;
Like Deſtiny, admitted no Repeal:
Thy WORD Thy Honour, Bond, and Oracle.
Cou'd Gallick LEAGUES or OATHS but half ſo bind;
With half Thy TRUTH the ſullied Lillies ſhin'd,
Long, long had EƲROPE's Bloody Flag been Furl'd,
And Halcyon Peace had Brooded o're the WORLD.
No Foreign Bolts had all theſe Sorrows coſt:
War's Thunder had been Huſht; Nor GODFREY Loſt.
How Rich the Furniture t' a Private Breaſt?
What Wealth had ev'n One Little World Poſſeſt?
Oh! might the Greater Globe Thy Pattern'd Honour rule;
How Courts, States, Crowns, might Learn, ev'n from Thy City-School.
Faith, th' Atlas of the World, Society,
Converſe, and Commerce; ev'n Humanity
It ſelf, our whole Great ALL's upheld by THEE.
If an Inviolate VVORD is that Rich Mine;
Oh, GODFREY! were all Breaſts but fill'd like Thine!
Nay, wou'd our Nobleſt Lips but Breathe like Thee,
Her Face ev'n GREATNESS, in Thy Mirrour, ſee:
No Ʋnpaid Scarlet then, in Bluſhes dy'd;
No City Groans wou'd ſhade the Gay Court Pride:
In what True State would Engliſh Grandeur move?
The Knees Below bent to the Heads Above!
The Byrſe the Honour'd Palace wou'd Careſs;
And the Poor Plough, the Gawdy Chariot Bleſs.
TRUTH, that Fair Jem in GODFREY's Casket ſet,
That ev'n his Furrs might ſhame the Coronet.
Did Thy FRANK SOUL in ev'ry Boſome reign,
Falſehood and Fraud, with all their Vizard Train;
Nay, that Court-Shadow, Flatt'ry, vaniſht quite;
Heav'ns! What a Fogg wou'd Clear before ſuch Light?
Nor did Thy MORAL Glories only ſhine.
An equal Homager to Truth DIVINE,
More Faithful Knee our Altars ne're cou'd Grace,
Deſcended from Religion's Sir Edm. Godfrey. CHAMPION-RACE.
And where that Glorious MARTYR's Image reigns,
(Enricht both by His VIRTUES, and His VEINS)
Well might th' Hereditary Beams inſpire,
Enlighten'd by ſuch Tranſmigrated Fire.
Let Cloyſt'rers vainly boaſt, Religion dwells
In Solitary Grotts, and Lonely Cells;
Born only for Themſelves, think HEAV'N to pleaſe;
The Drones of Life, in all the Ruſt of Eaſe.
No ſuch dull Wreathes Thy Temples did adorn;
GODFREY was ne'r to Lazy Virtues born.
BUS'INESS, Sloth's Shame, Life's Honourable Toyl,
And Induſtry's fair Growth, His Harveſt Pile;
Far as Seas rowl, or Canvas Wings can fly,
NATURE his Garden, EARTH his Granary;
Like th' Hybla Forager; from each kind Flow'r
To his Rich Hive the laded Sweets he bore:
Or like the more fam'd Bird of the Proud Eaſt,
In a VVarm Sun Built his own Spicy Neſt.
Nor did His Soaring SOUL leſs Active move;
Not Clogg'd Below, to check her Flight Above:
No; His Pois'd CARE held the great Ballance ev'n
Betwixt the Buſy World, and Studied Heav'n.
Nay, the more Worldly Bleſſings that he reap'd,
But Plum'd and Wing'd his PIETY: As They heap'd,
He look'd up to the Source from whence They flow'd;
And but Paid Heav'n the more, the more He Ow'd.
INDUSTRY ev'n came in before the Plough,
E're Man the Fig-Leaves wore, or Sweating Brow:
And our Great Sire, by the CREATOR grac'd,
In His Ʋntill'd, Ʋnforfeit EDEN plac'd:
In his Rich Soyl the Lord of Humane Kind,
Had ſtill ſome Charge, ſome Truſt, ſome Task, aſſign'd;
In his High Seat held not that Sluggiſh Bliſs,
Either to Lull or Bask, tho' ev'n in Paradice.
If INDUSTRY did to Thy Portion fall,
Whether Thy Fate, Thy Chance, Thy Choice, or All;
That Penetrating WIT, DEPTH ſo Profound,
JUDGMENT ſo Quick, INTEGRITY ſo Sound;
By Nature Form'd and Stampt for Charge and Truſt,
Thy Hand was Fitted, and Thy Stars were Juſt.
Thus all the Active Poſts our GODFREY held,
No more than His Creation-Work fullfill'd.
Fatiegue was but Thy Play; and Buſineſs more
The Plume Thy Brow, than Load Thy Shoulders wore.
His Globe Thy Atlas with that Eaſe ſuſtain'd,
And ſo all Sprightly Thy Minerva reign'd;
That Genius and Diſpatch, as cou'd go through
At once the Martha's Task, and Mary's too.
Thus at ThyRoyal Bank. Helm of GOLD, Thy Short-liv'd Pride,
No Abler, Truſtier PILOT Hand cou'd Guide:
That fair Foundation ROYAL, that (if my
Too poor Propheticks may dare Speak ſo high)
Beyond her yet too Narrow Leaſe, ſhall ſtand,
With its Ʋnſhaken Head, till Time's laſt Sand.
Whoſe Circulating Warmth ſhall never ceaſe,
At once the Nerves of WAR, and Veins of PEACE;
Commerce, Arts, Arms, all her own fair Increaſe.
A TREASURY, from whoſe Diffuſive Mine
Our Glebe ſhall Fatten, and our THRONE ſhall Shine.
This Honour'd Sphere of Conſtellated WORTH,
Saw her Lov'd GODFREY's ſmiling Morn ſet forth,
And thy ſad Setting too—And here, in all
The Pitying Dew does at that Setting fall,
From Thy kind Pylades, Thy Sir Will. Scowen. FRIEND and MATE,
The Tend reſt,Being within Two Yards of the Fatal Shot. Neareſt WITNESS of Thy Fate,
Is the Firſt Tribute paid. And, Oh! a more
Than Common Pity, LOVE here ſwells the Show'r;
That Love, and Faithful Ami'ty, that ſupplies
At once his o're charg'd Breaſt, and flowing Eyes.
True Mourner, Friend; nay, t' add one Title more,
Thy Truſt, Worth, Virtues, all, True SUCCESSOR;
Thy Treble HEIR.—So a Fair Roſe full grown,
Off from the Stalk by ſome rude Tempeſt blown;
The next Twin-Bloſſom, the next Morning-Dawn,
Op'd, Spread, and Dreſt in the ſame Crimſon Lawn;
On the ſame Branch a New fair Pendant Jem,
With the ſame Sweets new decks the Widow'd Stem.
Well, Patriot GODFREY, ſince it is Decreed,
Such Publick MERIT muſt Ʋntimely Bleed;
The Great DISPENSER for Thy Doom declares,
And our Juſt Grief ſhall Pay Thee all it Dares:
Hard-fetter'd Sorrow! Our poor Tongue-ty'd Woe
May Wayl, but muſt not Murmur at the Blow.
How War, more Blind than Love, his Wounds do's give!
So Call'd to Dye, what moſt Deſerv'd to Live!
VVhat's Battle, but the Lottery of Fame?
The Puſhing VVarriour plays that Deſp'rate Game,
And only Sets a Life, to Win a Name.
War is the Mart of Honour, to ſupply
Th' Ʋnfurniſht Brow; whil'ſt at a Price ſo High,
'Tis they that Want it, thither come to Buy.
Let Meaner VVorth, then, ſeek out Martial Fields,
To Raiſe that GLORY Blood and Danger builds.
HONOUR, Alas! was all Thy Own before;
Ev'n Lawrels to Thy Brow cou'd ſcarce add more.
Thy Brighter Olave Chaplet ſhin'd ſo Fair,
Renown Thou thither Broughtſt, not Soughtſt it there.
And now, for the Laſt Sweets to ſtrew Thy Tomb;
Sweets, that in th' Herauld's Garden ne'r could Bloom:
A Garland of thoſe Flow'rs, which all his Field
Of poorer Or, nor Argent, ne'r cou'd yeild.
Let Prouder GREATNESS be with Scutcheons bleſt;
And glory in a Title, and a Creſt:
Honours, VVealth, Dignities, their narrower Pride
A ſmall Succeſſion, and few Heirs, divide.
They who that Ampler Patrimony claim,
A Virtuous Memory, and a Good Name;
'Tis They dye truly Rich: They leave behind
A Leg'acy to no leſs than all Mankind.
